message_1:
Consider the following time series data that shows the monthly sales of a product for a year:

| Month | Sales |
| ----- | ----- |
| Jan   | 150   |
| Feb   | 175   |
| Mar   | 200   |
| Apr   | 225   |
| May   | 250   |
| Jun   | 275   |
| Jul   | 300   |
| Aug   | 325   |
| Sep   | 350   |
| Oct   | 375   |
| Nov   | 400   |
| Dec   | 425   |

What is the mean monthly sales of the product over the year?
message_2:
To find the mean monthly sales of the product over the year, we need to sum the sales for each month and then divide by the number of months.

Mean monthly sales = (150 + 175 + 200 + 225 + 250 + 275 + 300 + 325 + 350 + 375 + 400 + 425) / 12

Mean monthly sales = (3375) / 12

Mean monthly sales = 281.25

The mean monthly sales of the product over the year is 281.25.
